He is requesting this loan to purchase a car in order to transport products by himself and also to provide a service in his free time (to work as a taxi driver).

loans.use: to purchase a car in order to transport products and also to provide a taxi service

loans.name: Hukmatulo

texts.ru:
Хукматуло 48 – летний женатый мужчина, проживающий в городе Дангара. У него трое детей, одна девочка и трое парней. Его старший сын занимается своим бизнесом, а остальные учатся в школе. 
Хукматуло занимается торговлей. В 2008 году он открыл продуктовый магазин у себя дома. На сегодняшний день у него магазин со смешанным товаром, где он продает DVD диски, продукты, хозяйственные товары, детскую одежду и игрушки. 
Хукматуло берет кредит для покупки продуктов питания с целью увеличения оборота.
texts.en: Hukmatulo is a 48 year-old married man, living in the city of Dangara.  He has three children - one girl and two boys.  His oldest son is involved in his own business, and the other children attend a school.  Hukmatulo is involved in sales.  He opened a food market at home in 2008.  Today, he has a store with a mixed selection of merchandise and sells DVD disks, products, household goods, children's clothing and toys.  Hukmatulo is requesting this loan to purchase food products in order to increase product turnover.

loans.use: to purchase food products in order to increase product turnover

loans.name: Leila Marina

texts.es:
Doña Leila Marina es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se siente muy orgullosa de haber nacido y crecido en este pequeño y humilde pueblo, de pertenecer a una familia luchadora.
Su mamá como toda una mujer emprendedora se dedicó casi toda su vida a elaborar dulces para llevarles el pan de cada día a sus hijos y les enseño este oficio merecedor sobre todo a doña Leila que es era una de sus hijas mayores.

Hoy en la actualidad tiene una gran experiencia en elaborar dulces como arroz de leche, antefrijol, atolillo, cajeta y mota de atol, los cuales los elabora a diario para salir a vender de manera ambulante y caminando en las diferentes calles del municipio. 
Diario elabora un dulce diferente para no aburrir a sus clientes con lo mismo, generalmente lo vende después del almuerzo por en el  pueblo se acostumbra a comer un postre o dulce después de esta comida.

Cabe señalar que el antefrijol es el más apetecido por sus clientes el cual es una especie de cajeta elaborado a base de frijol y azúcar, por este motivo solicita a ceprodel un crédito para comprar los insumos más necesarios como azúcar, aceite, frijoles y arroz.

Agracede a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo a los pequeños comerciantes que luchan día a día para ganarse dignamente el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Leila Marina is from El Sauce and she feels very proud to have been born and raised in this small, humble town and to belong to a hardworking family.
Her mother, an enterprising woman, has devoted almost her whole life to making sweets in order to bring home the daily bread to her children.  She taught all of the children this worthwhile trade, especially Leila who is one of her older daughters.

Today, she has a lot of experience making sweets such as rice pudding, antefrijol, “atolillo” (a custard made with milk, egg yolks, sugar, cornstarch, and lightly flavored with cinnamon), “cajeta” (a caramel type dessert made from milk, sugar, and vanilla), and “mota de atol”,(a custard-like dessert flavored with the piñuela flower).  She makes these desserts daily and sells them on foot, walking through the town’s various streets. 

She makes different sweets each day so as not to bore her customers with the same thing.  She usually sells her sweets after lunch because people in the village are accustomed to eating a dessert or sweet after this meal.

Note that the antefrijol, a kind of caramel made from beans and sugar, is craved by customers the most.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to purchase the ingredients she needs the most: sugar, oil, beans, and rice.  She is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for supporting small business owners that strive daily to make a decent living.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
El Señor  Victoriano tiene 67 años de edad, convive con su esposa  en unión libre,  reside en compañía de sus hijos y esposa  en  el municipio de Siguatepeque, Departamento de Comayagua.
Victoriano desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, anteriormente producía caña de azúcar. Actualmente produce café en pergamino seco debido a que éste se vende a mejor precio en el mercado.
Con el propósito de mejorar la asistencia de su cultivo, Victoriano ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y el pago de mano de obra en la limpieza de la finca para proceder a la cosecha del grano.
Victoriano espera mejorar su cosecha en esta temporada, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos para bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Victoriano, 67, lives with his wife in a common law union.  He lives with his wife and children in the municipality of Siguatepeque, Comayagua Department.  Since he was very young Victoriano has worked in agriculture; he used to grow sugarcane but now grows coffee in dry parchment stage which is the one that has the highest market price.

Aiming at improving his crop maintenance, Victoriano has requested a 10,000 Lempira loan he plans to use to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs to do the weeding prior to harvesting the grains.  Victoriano plans to improve his harvest this season which will increase income for his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs to remove weeds from his coffee farm.

loans.name: Melve

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Melve works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling fish.  Melve is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Melve has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 15 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 44 years old.  She is married and has six children.

Margie works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as rice, shampoo, sardines and other groceries.

Margie has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Margie aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as rice, shampoo, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is 34 years old.  She is married and has three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Edlyn is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been raising pigs for 12 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials including plastic, iron and bottles.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Diogracia

texts.en:
This is Diogracia.  She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Diogracia hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Florencia works hard to support her family.  She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Florencia is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Florencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Badiya

texts.ru: Бадия жительница города Исфара. Ей 54 года. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Муж Бадии работает бухгалтером. Бадия сама занимается купле - продажей сухофруктов. Она в основном занимается продажей кураги. Торговлей она занимается пять лет. Бадия берет кредит для покупки сухофруктов.
texts.en: Badiya is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is 54 years old, married and has one child.  Badiya's husband works as an accountant.  Badiya is involved in buying and selling dried fruit.  She primarily sells dried apricots.  She has been involved in sales for five years.  Badiya is requesting this loan to purchase dried fruit.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruit

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Заррина проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Муж Заррины находится и работает за границей. Заррина на протяжении восьми лет работает на рынке. У нее имеется торговая точка, где она занимается торговлей тканей и женской одежды. 
Заррина берет кредит для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Zarrina lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 37 years old, married and has three children.  Zarrina's husband lives and works abroad.  Zarrina has been working at a market for eight years.  She has a retail outlet, where she sells fabrics and women's clothing.  Zarrina is requesting this loan to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Yosira

texts.es: Yosira de 25 años de edad, vive en el Macroproyecto de Vivienda sostenible” Ciudad Bicentenario” y allí se dedica a su oficio de comerciante de productos de belleza,  perfumería y ropa; actividad que nació desde hace 3 años. Sus principales productos son la ropa, los suéteres, perfumes, cosméticos y cremas, que compra en el mercado de la ciudad y a través de catálogos, cuando estos traen mercancía con descuentos especiales, para ofrecerle los mejores precios a su clientela, que le paga de contado y a crédito, en cuotas pactadas de acuerdo alas posibilidades de cada uno. Sus principales clientes son vecinos del barrio y de otros sectores, que ya la reconocen y están atentos a hacerle pedidos, así como ella está pendiente de responderles oportunamente. En la actualidad con motivo de las fiestas de fin de año, los pedidos son superiores a su capacidad de compra y esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa productos de belleza y mercancía, que han solicitado sus clientes. Con su credikiva tendrá la oportunidad de aumentar sus ventas y esta es justamente la razón de éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Yosira, 25, lives in the “Ciudad Bicentenario” sustainable housing macro project and works there as a beauty products, perfumery and clothing merchant, an activity that started three years ago.  Her main products are clothes, sweaters, perfume, cosmetics and creams that she buys in the city market and through catalogues when the catalogues have discounted merchandise she can offer to customers at better prices; they pay her cash or she sells on credit with payment plans agreed upon according to each customer’s ability to pay.  Her main customers are from the local neighborhood and from other sectors that know her and are quick to place orders with her just like she’s quick to respond to them in an opportune manner.

Because of the approaching end-of-year festivities, orders surpass her purchasing ability and this is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan to buy beauty products and merchandise her customers have requested.  With a Kiva loan she’ll be able to increase sales and this is precisely why her investment will be successful.

loans.use: to buy clothes, beauty products and merchandise.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia, 47, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to a driver and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Lilia oversees a van for rental business. She has one L300 van which she makes available for renting. Her husband is the driver when her van is rented. She also has a 'tricycle' unit for extra income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 20,000 monthly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her van. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lilia dreams of giving her family a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their van.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn has a business buying  and selling bananas in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.  Josephine has been in this business for 21 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items like shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es: Yenny de 45 años de edad,  tiene una peluquería en la ciudad de Cartagena donde habita con su familia. Su negocio inició desde hace 20 años, teniendo en cuenta que siempre le había gustado todo lo relacionado con la estética y la belleza. Los principales servicios que ofrece, están relacionados con el mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional, de acuerdo al perfil de cada cliente, ella diariamente hace cortes de cabello, tintura, hace manicure y pedicure, a damas caballeros y a niños que son su principal clientela. Diariamente trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, aunque hay días en los cuales su jornada laboral  se extiende,  hasta que su último cliente recibe el servicio por el cual llegó al salón de belleza. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará sillas, hará pintar su local y comprará insumos de belleza, para comercializarlo una vez asesore a su clientela. Con su credikiva asegura el éxito de su propósito, que es el de aumentar sus ingresos y tener muchos mas clientes, pues la inversión la realiza al final del año, época en la cual se incrementan las ventas en su mercado y hay mas dinero circulante.
texts.en:
Yenny, 45, has a barber shop in the city of Cartagena where she lives with her family.  She started the business 20 years ago because she’s always liked everything to do with beauty and hair styling.  The main services she offers are related to improving personal and professional image according to each customer’s profile.  She does daily haircuts, hair coloring, manicures and pedicures for women, men and children who are her main clientele.  She works every day from 8 in the morning until 8 at night although there are days when her work schedule is even longer until she takes care of every last customer who comes by for service in her salon.

She’s currently requesting a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy chairs, beauty supplies to sell to her customers after consulting with them and she will have the salon painted.  Her Kiva loan guarantees the success of her project which is to increase income and have many more customers because she’s making the investment at the end of the year which is when sales increase in her market and there is more cash in circulation.

loans.use: to buy chairs and beauty supplies and also to paint her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for making soft brooms to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 34 years old and married with four children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Leah has a business selling frozen food items and ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 21000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of frozen foods and clothing to sell.

Leah has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of frozen foods and ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for needed maintenance.

loans.name: Laddys

texts.es: La artesania es en el municipio de San Jacinto, departamento de Bolivar, el principale  generador  de ingresos de esta región, aportado por la tradicion cultural, trasmitida de generación en generacion. Laddys oriunda de esta región, no es la excepción y ella vende las mochilas, hamacas que complementa con otros articulos, usualmente consumidos por los habitantes de la misma región, pero mas aun, por turistas y comerciantes en otros departamentos del país. Laddys además de generar ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su familia con estos productos, practica la repostería, con la cual tambien gana dinero y apoya los gastos familiares.Su negocio nació hace 12 años y aun no se detiene, porque su afan de producir tiene un gran propósito de prosperidad para su hogar. Sus ventas las realiza a credito y de contado, durante todos los dias y su meta es ampliar la cobertura de su clientela, pero su mayor desafio es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer finacimeinto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará lencería, mercancias edredones, hamacas y mochilas, para tener un buen surtido a propósito de las fiestas de fin de año que se aproximan y ganar un poco mas le resulta muy satisfactorio.
texts.en:
The main source of income in the region of San Jacinto in Bolívar Department is crafts, a traditional culture that’s passed down from generation to generation.  Laddys is from this region and she’s not the exception to this for she sells backpacks and hammocks that she complements with other items that are usually used by local residents but even more so by tourists and merchants from other departments in the country.

In addition to selling these products, Laddys also helps to generate family income by making pastries that she also earns family income from.  Her business started 12 years ago and is still going strong because her drive to produce has as its goal her home’s prosperity.  She sells both for cash and on credit every day and her goal is to expand her range of customers but her greatest challenge is insufficient working capital to do so.

This is whys she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy lingerie, comforters, hammocks and backpacks to have a good assortment on hand for the approaching end-of-year festivities and to earn a bit more profit which is very pleasing for her.
e año que se aproximan y ganar un poco mas le resulta muy satisfactorio.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, tote bags, comforters and lingerie.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more lumber to resell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

Letecia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Florencia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Florencia is borrowing 17000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items like sugar, bread, soft-drinks, and other groceries for her general store business.

Florencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, bread, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 44 years old and married with seven children.  Two of them are currently going to school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Loreta has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle business.  Loreta has been in this business for 24 years. 

In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make cakes and breads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sand and gravel to resell

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Икром житель города Исфара. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Икром вместе с женой предоставляет услугу. Он печет лепешки, а также национальный вид хлеба (фатир и кулча) для оптовой реализации. В этой области Икром пять лет. Он берет кредит для закупа угля и муки, чтобы запастись на зиму.
texts.en: Ikrom lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 32 years old and he is married with two children.  Ikrom and his wife are in business together.  They bake round bread and national breads (fatir and kulcha) for wholesale.  He has been in this line of work for five years.  He is asking for a loan to purchase coal and flour to stock up for the winter.

loans.use: to stock up on coal and flour for the winter.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Жена Хасана занимается шитьем женских халатов и платьев. Хасан занимается торговлей готовых и вышитых платьев, халатов вместе с женой. Также он занимается развозками пассажиров на собственной маршрутке Газель. Хасан берет кредит для приобретения тканей, чтобы увеличить количество производимого товара. Так как Хасан был в разъездах, его жена была сфотографирована одна.
texts.en: Hasan lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 45 years old, married and he has four children.  His wife sews women's robes and dresses.  Hasan sells the finished robes and dresses with his wife.  He also works as a driver, transporting passengers in his own "Gazelle" minibus.  He is asking for a loan to purchase fabrics so to increase the quantity of goods produced.  Since Hasan was on the road, his wife was photographed alone.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru:
Далер зарабатывает строительными работами по найму. Он более десяти лет проработал строителем. Далер берет кредит для приобретения стройматериалов, чтобы продолжить свою деятельность. 
Далер женат. Ему 31 год. Он является отцом двоих детей. Жена Далера домохозяйка.
texts.en: Daler is a construction worker for hire.  He has been in construction for more than 10 years.  He is asking for a loan to purchase building materials so he can continue his work.  Daler is 31 years old, married and is the father of two children.  His wife is a homemaker.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Tania Jacqueline

texts.es:
Tania tiene 31 años de edad, ella vive en el distrito de Tate, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Tate se caracteriza por desarrollarse la agricultura, así mismo se pueden encontrar muchos restaurantes turísticos, los cuales ofrecen platillos típicos como la riquísima Carapulcra, sopa seca, chicharrones, arroz con pato, entre otros. Tania es muy trabajadora, sobre todo porque es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales tienen 14 y 10 años de edad y por quienes se esfuerza mucho cada día para poder darles una vida digna y sobre todo porque desea que sean personas de bien. Día a Día Tania trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de gaseosas, cervezas, entre otros, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Tania esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una congeladora para su negocio y de esta manera poder conservar mejor los productos y brindar un mejor servicio, así ella mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Construir su casa y darle una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Tania is 31 years old and she lives in the district of Tate in Ica, Perú.  The district of Tate is characterized by developing agriculture, likewise many tourist restaurants can be found which offer traditional dishes like the delicious “Carapulcra,” (a traditional Peruvian stew made of pork, dried potatoes, peppers, ground peanuts and spices), “sopa seca” (dry soup, a soup made of chicken, vegetables and noodles), “chicharrones” (pork rinds or cracklings) and “arroz con pato” (duck with rice), among others. 

Tania is very hardworking, especially because she is the mother of two children, who are 14 and 10 years old and for whom she strives hard every day to be able to give them a dignified life and above all because she wants them to be good people.  Day to day Tania works in her small business selling soda and beer, among other things.  She dedicates around 10 hours a day to her business and can serve up to 10 customers daily.  She believes that the business is going very well for her because she is very friendly with her customers and above all because she has a great desire to get ahead. 

Tania is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have provided to her she will be able to buy a freezer for her business and in this way be able to better preserve the products and provide better service.  Thus she will improve her income and will continue struggling to be able to make her greatest dream a reality: “To build her house and to give a better quality of life and a good education to her children.”

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Agripina works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Agripina is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

Agripina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn is 34 years old, married, and has one child.

Lovelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lovelyn has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years, and she also earns income from buying and selling rice.

Lovelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Adelina works hard to support her family.

She has a hog-raising business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. Adelina is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Adelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.ru: Матлюба жительница города Исфара. Ей 22 года. Она не замужем. Матлюба более трех лет занимается торговлей. Она в основном занимается купле – продажей кураги и миндаля. Матлюба берет кредит для покупки сухофруктов.
texts.en: Matlyuba lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 22 years old and is not married.  Matlyuba has worked in sales for more than three years.  She mainly buys and sells almonds and dried apricots.  She is asking for a loan to buy dried fruits.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits.

loans.name: Vohidjon

texts.ru: Вохидчон проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Вохидчон занимается купле – продажей хлебобулочных и кондитерских изделий. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 7 лет. Вохидчон берет кредит для приобретения кондитерских изделий.
texts.en: Vohidjon lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 27 years old and is married with three children.  His work involves buying and selling breads and confectionery products.  He has been in this line of work for seven years.  Vohidjon is asking for a loan to buy confectionery products.

loans.use: to buy confectionery products.

loans.name: Deysi Corina

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en el municipio de San Manuel, Cortes, junto a su hijo y una prima. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, tiene siete años de vender ropa variada, sandalias, zapatos, perfumes y achinería. Vende en su casa donde tiene su clientela que le hace pedidos de productos y de manera ambulante, los fines de semana se ubica al frente de una maquila a vender su mercadería. 
Deysi ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para surtir de mercadería, comprara mas ropa nueva y achinería como colas, ganchos de pelo, juguetes y otros para vender. Este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar los ingresos y su negocio y a incrementar el inventario. Su meta es continuar con el negocio y crecer día a día para obtener ingresos para poder ayudar a su hijo y a su familia.
texts.en:
Deysi, 27, is a single mother living in the municipality of San Manuel, Cortes, with her son and a cousin.  She’s always been a merchant and has been selling clothes, sandals, shoes, perfume and low-cost novelty items for seven years.  She sells at home where her customers come to order products and she also sells from place to place.  She sets up in front of an assembly plant on weekends to sell her merchandise.

Deysi has requested a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy more new clothes and low-cost items like hair fasteners, hair clips, toys and others to sell.  This loan will help her improve income and her business and to increase inventory.  Her goal is to stay in business and grow every day to earn income to help her son and her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and low-cost novelty items to resell.

loans.name: Hilaria Ursula

texts.es: Hilaria Úrsula de 60 anos de edad, casada con 10 hijos, todos mayores de edad, del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona comercial muy productiva. Hilaria tiene por actividad económica la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene 30 anos de tener el negocio. El negocio consiste en realizar compras en las fincas aledañas, y su medio de trasporte en un carretón jalados por un caballo el cual es de su propiedad  salen a  comprar las frutas y verduras, posteriormente las vende de forma ambulantes en los repartos. Y en mercado de la localidad tiene un puesto de venta. El negocio surgió hace muchos anos con ayuda de sus esposo el cual era agricultor y lo que sembraban lo salían a vender en un carretón, hoy en día además de lo que producen en su finca, comprar y vende en fincas aledañas. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de frutas y verduras, principalmente en plátanos ya que hay cosecha en estos momentos y quieren aprovechar las ventas. Hilaria Úrsula agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a los pequeños comerciantes en países con limitaciones de fuentes de trabajo como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Hilaria Úrsula, 60, is married and has ten children, all adults.  She’s from Chinandega Department, a place noted for being a very productive commercial zone.  Hilaria’s economic activity is selling fruit and vegetables.  She’s been in business 30 years.  The business consists in buying from adjacent farms.  Her means of transportation is a horse-drawn cart she owns.  She goes out in it to buy fruit and vegetables and then sells them from place to place in the suburbs.  She also has a stand in the local market.  

The business arose many years ago with help from her husband who was a farmer and they’d go out in a cart selling what he grew on his farm.  Today, in addition to what they grow on their farm she also buys and sells in adjacent farms.  

The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital purchasing fruit and vegetables; mainly bananas, since they are currently harvested and they want to take advantage of sales.  Hilaria Úrsula is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders provide small merchants in countries with limited sources of employment like Nicaragua so that they can have a way of earning a livelihood with dignity.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Josefa Maritza

texts.es: Josefa Maritza de 54 anos de edad, casada con un hijo mayor de edad, el cual asiste a la Universidad de la localidad. Josefa es originaria de la ciudad de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Tiene por actividad económica la venta de carne, desde hace 23 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad, actividad que consisten en vender carne de cerdos, res, pollo. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de la localidad. En la foto se refleja a Josefa con un clienta la cual esta comprando carne. Josefa Maritza inicio este negocio por la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Ella ya ha tenido crédito con fundación y ha demostrado ser responsable en tiempo y forma. En la actualidad el financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo e invertir en la compra y venta de carne variada y de calidad. Josefa Maritza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en: Josefa Maritza is 54 years old. She is married and has an adult son who attends the local university. Josefa is originally from the city of León, which is located in the western part of the country. Her business is the sale of meat. She has worked in this activity for 23 years. Her business consists of selling pork, beef, and chicken. The business is located in the local market. Pictured in the photo with Josefa is a client buying meat.  Josefa Maritza began the business out of the need to have a source of employment to help with the household expenses. She has already had a loan from the foundation and has shown that she is responsible [in making her payments] on time and properly. Now she needs the financing to invest in working capital and purchase a variety of good quality meat. Josefa Maritza is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a means of living with dignity.

loans.use: to stock her business with the purchase of a variety of good quality meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials such as ceramic tiles, corrugated metal, sand, cement, plastic pipe glue, blocks to renovate her house.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel de 64 años de edad, casado con 4 hijos mayores de edad mayor de edad. Miguel es de la localidad del Jicaral, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Miguel ángel tiene por actividad económica el destace de res y cerdo  y venta de ganado. El Negocio de Miguel  consisten en salir a las comarca vecinas y su medio de transporte es un caballo, el viaja alrededor de unos 6 kilometro a comprar ganado y cerdo y posteriormente venderlo a sus clientes fijos y eventuales, tiene 9 años de dedicarse a dicho negocio. Miguel ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado que es responsable es sus pagos en tiempo y forma. En la actualidad está solicitando el financiamiento para invertir  en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos y caballo que le están ofreciendo en buen precio y quiere aprovecha dicha oportunidad para obtener mejores ganancias y poder satisfacer a sus clientes. Miguel agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno. En un país con tanta carencia de fuentes de trabajo fijas.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel, aged 64, is married and has 4 children who are all grown.  Miguel is from the area of Jicaral, a place in the northern region of the country.  Miguel Ángel butchers beef and pork and sells cattle for a living.  His business consists of going around the neighboring areas, and he rides there and back on horseback.  He travels up to 6 kilometers to buy cattle and pigs and then sells these to his customers, both through standing orders and new business.  He has spent the past 9 years in this line of work.

Miguel has worked previously with Fundación and has proven himself to be a timely and responsible person in regards to his loan payments.  He is currently seeking a loan for investment in his working capital so that he can buy a lot of pigs and horses that are currently offered at a good price, as he wants to take advantage of this opportunity to make a better profit and satisfy his customers' needs.  Miguel gratefully acknowledges the assistance that the Kiva investors provide for people with scant economic resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a decent working environment. Especially in a country with such lack of permanent jobs.

loans.use: to invest in his working capital for buying and selling pigs and cattle.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Luzminda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from fish vending.  Luzminda is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her business.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 45 years old, a married woman with four children.  Two of her children are in school.

Diosdada is in the agricultural field, raising pigs in the Philippines. Diosdada requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Diosdada has been raising pigs for two years, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Diosdada would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. Maribel is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Maribel requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store, such as noodles, shampoo, canned goods, soap, etc.

Maribel has been in this business for six years.

Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store, such as noodles, shampoo, canned goods, soap, etc.

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Исматулло родился в 1964 году. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Его жена бизнес леди. Дети учатся в школе и университете. Исматулло работает в Санитарно- Эпидемическом центре и его зарплата не позволяет ему оплатить за учебы сына в университете, так как Салим в этом году окончил школу и поступил в  Государственный Национальный Университет  Таджикистана. Салим участвовал в нескольких олимпиадах по гуманитарным наукам. Он очень способный парень. В свободное время читает книги и занимается спортом. Исматулло запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы сына в университете. Исматулло и Салим ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ismatullo was born in 1964.  He is married and has five children at home.  His wife is a businesswoman and his children are in school and university.  Ismatullo works at the Sanitary-Epidemic Center and his income is not enough to pay for his son's university education, as this year Salim has graduated from high school and has been accepted at the National State University of Tajikistan.  Salim participated in a few Olympiads of the humanities.  He is a very capable young man.  In his free time, he reads books and plays sports.  Ismatullo is asking for a loan to pay for his son's university education.  Ismatullo and Salim are awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, meats, vegetables and tubers.

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Caminando hacia el Futuro” está conformado por 16 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; repostería, bazar, confección, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de articulos de plásticos, venta de articulos para el hogar, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Conchalí, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Erica, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una falda de color rojo, una polera de color Calipso, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la artesanía, desde hace 20 años. Comenta que trabaja con su hermana realizando ropa artesanal, trabaja en su casa y algunas veces en las ferias artesanales ya que tiene a una persona que le trabaja el puesto, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la comuna de independencia que se especializa en vender telas, géneros, hilos, a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará telas, hilos, lanas.
Una de las metas de Erica es poder independizarse y tener su propio local, para crecer como microempresaria, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Erica vive junto a su madre, dos hermanos y su hijo de 25 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral y personal, es independizarse, tener su negocio e instalarse en un local establecido.
Ella está contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación.
Conchalí es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile)  ubicada hacia el norte de la misma. Posee un barrio industrial delimitado, y múltiples actividades económicas y comerciales de pequeño tamaño, incluyendo ferias libres, talleres artesanales, garajes, terminales de buses, entre otros. El sector microempresarial es muy relevante en su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
The ‘Cambiando Hacia el Futuro' [Changing Towards the Future] communal bank is comprised of 16 entrepreneurs who make their livings in different areas including pastries, bazaar type store, sewing, selling sportswear, selling plastic items, selling household items, and providing services, among others.  They all belong to the Conchalí commune in the city of Santiago.

Erica is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she is standing in the first row, and she is the third person from the right.  She is wearing a red skirt and a turquoise top.  Her hair is dark brown, and she wears it down.

She has been working with handicrafts for 20 years.  She says that she works with her sister making handmade clothing.  She works at her house and sometimes at the handicrafts fair.  She has a person who works at the stand.  Her work schedule is according to her availability.

She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs at the Comuna de Independencia, which specializes in selling fabric, thread, and other goods at a low cost.  Therefore, it is cost effective.

She will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, and wool.  One of Erica’s goals is to be able to become independent and to have her own place in order to grow as a small businesswoman.  This way she will generate greater income and have a better quality of life.

Erica lives with her mother, two siblings, and her 25 year old son, who attends school.  Her work and personal dreams are to become independent, to have her business, and to set herself up at an established place.

She is happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza.  It will allow her to invest in her business.  She says that the trainings have been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development.  She has learned to organize and distribute her income and investments in a better way.  Regarding the group in her communal bank, she says that there is very good communication.

Conchalí is a commune within the metropolitan area of Santiago, Chile's capital, and it is located in the northern part of this area. It has a defined industrial area, and many financial activities and small businesses, including street markets, craft workshops, garages, and bus terminals, etc. The microenterprise sector is very relevant to its commercial activity.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for use in making viand (rice dishes).

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a retail business selling copra (dried coconut meat) in the Philippines.

Jessel requested a 18000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more copra to sell.

She has been in this business for five years.

Jessel would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more copra (dried coconut meat) to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
This is Richard, 35, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Analyn, a housewife and the mother of his children. He and his wife manage their own household while operating this business. He is working hard to provide income for his everyday expenses.

Richard operates a mineral water station. He sells mineral water to his retail customers by the container (5 gallons per container) at a profit. His regular customers for his mineral water are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. He will be using the loan to upgrade his facilities and buy more stocks of mineral water to expand capacity. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Richard dreams of growing his business in the coming years. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to upgrade his facilities and buy more mineral water for his business.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Las Estrellitas(flat)es un grupo integrado por 9 mujeres cada una de ellas realiza una actividad economica con la finalidad de ganar su propio dinero para dar a sus familias mejor calidad de vida, ella son: Maricela venta de manualidades, Isabel  venta de tacos, Maria venta de antojitos, Zuleyma venta de lencería,Maribel venta de antojitos, Verónica venta de antojitos, Reyna venta de comida y Bernardita venta de pan, este grupo esta ubicado en una comunidad llamada Las Limas y su gente se dedica al cultivo de caña y recolección de la resina de los arboles de hule.


Maricela Platica que se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades como lo son blusas, zapatos, carpetas, vestidos, mantillas, ropita de bebe tejidas y servilletas bordadas, ella realiza sus trabajos por pedidos y como ya tiene varios años realizando esta actividad sin salir a ofrecer la gente llega a su casa ha hacerle pedidos. Ella dijo que aprendió a realizar manualidades porque sus padres no pudieron pagarle mas sus estudios así que aprendió un oficio que en el futuro la ayudara a salir adelante.
Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de hilos, ganchos, agujas, telas, zuelas, listones para continuar elaborando sus manualidades.
ella desea invertir sus ganancias en la compra de mas materiales para continuar su actividad  y poco a poco ir arreglando su casa.
Este grupo envía un saludo de agradecimiento a las personas que ayudaran a que su préstamo sea posible.
texts.en:
“Las Estrellitas” (flat) group is nine women each with her own economic activity aimed at earning income of her own to provide their families with better quality of life.  They are: Maricela who sells crafts, Isabel who sells tacos, María who sells fast-food snacks, Zuleyma who sells lingerie, Maribel who sells fast-food snacks, Verónica who sells fast-food snacks, Reyna who sells food and Bernardita who sells bread.  They are from a community called Las Limas whose residents work growing sugarcane and collecting sap from rubber trees.

Maricela relates that she works making knitted crafts like blouses, shoes, mats, dresses, shawls and baby clothes and embroidered napkins.  She does her work on order and since she’s been doing it for several years she doesn’t have to leave her house to sell because customers come to her to place their orders.  She said that she learned to make crafts because her parents were unable to pay for more schooling for her so she learned an occupation that would help her get ahead in the future.

She will use the loan to buy thread, knitting needles, needles, fabric, soles and ribbons to continue making her crafts.  She wants to use her profits to buy more materials to continue in her activity and gradually make home improvements.  

The group sends a message of appreciation to people who will help them make their loan possible.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, knitting needle and fabric.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has an ambulatory business vending dried fish in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by growing sugarcane. Marilou is borrowing  10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Elena Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Elena compró telas, camisetas, y accesorios, con los que vistió a mucha de su clientela y ganó dinero. En la actualidad está muy entusiasmada con esta inversión y está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el comprará telas e invertirá en el mantenimiento de su maquinaria,  pues es una temporada muy buena la de fin de año y debe estar bien preparada,  para responderle oportunamente a su clientela,  tal y como está acostumbrada. Ella está muy agradecida con los créditos y pide a sus financiadores que continúen con esa labor por muchos años más.
texts.en:
Elena bought fabric, t-shirts, and accessories with which she visited a lot of her customers and earned money.  She is currently very enthusiastic with this investment, and she is applying for a new Kiva loan.  

She will use the new loan to buy fabric and invest in the maintenance of her machinery.  The end of the year is a very good season, and she needs to be well-prepared in order to opportunely respond to her clientele as she is accustomed to doing.

She is very grateful for the loans, and she asks the lenders to continue with this work for many more years.

loans.use: to buy fabric and invest in the maintenance of her machinery.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
Doña Lourdes es otro de los integrantes del grupo Nuevo Horizonte, ella tiene la edad de 44 años,  está  casada con don Miguel que se dedica al trabajo del campo, ella platica que desde hace mas 4 años inicio a realizar ventas de pollo destazado en su hogar con la intención de ganar un poco de dinero extra para contribuir con los gastos de su hogar  y tener una mejor calidad de vida, también dice que ella siempre ha querido abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa ya que por su casa no hay tienda y sería un buen negocio , ella ha solicitado este crédito para invertirlo en la compra  de pollos y abarrotes (galletas, jabón, frijol, aceite, sopa, dulces, refrescos, arroz, leche y productos enlatados  ) para abrir su negocio,  Doña Lourdes desea que su negocio gane clientes y vender  mucho para que su tiendita crezca día con día. Este grupo agradece a Visión Fund el apoyo que les da a través de estos créditos.

los demas integrantes del grupo son:  
Carmen venta de manualidades 
Hilda venta de comida
virgina veta de comida
Gregorio carpinteria
Adriana venta de ropa
Hermelinda venta de comida
texts.en:
Lourdes is another one of the members of the "Nuevo Horizonte" ("New Horizon") communal bank. She's 44 years old and married to Miguel, who works in farming. Over four years ago, she started selling butchered chickens from her home in order to earn a little extra money for her household expenses and for improving her living conditions. She also reports that she has always wanted to open a small grocery store in her house, since there aren't any stores nearby and it would be a good business. She has requested this loan so she could use it to purchase chickens and groceries (cookies, soap, beans, cooking oil, soup, candy, refreshments, rice, milk and canned goods) in order to get her business started. Lourdes hopes that her business will gain customers and sell high, so that her small store may grow on a daily basis.
The other members of the communal bank are Carmen, who sells crafts; Hilda, who sells food; Virginia, who sells food; Gregorio, who's a carpenter; Adriana, who sells clothing; and Hermelinda, who sells food.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, cookies, refreshments, toilet paper, tuna, toothpaste, coffee, and shampoo.

location.town: Zona Urbana Ejidal, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oax

loans.name: Chacabuco Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Chacabuco” está confirmado por 15 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; repostería, venta de empanadas, kiosko, manicure, venta de ropa, venta de helados, venta de queques, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de recoleta, ubicada en la comuna de Santiago.
Maria Jose, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en cuclillas en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste blue jeans, chaleco de color beige, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado, en sus brazos carga a su pequeña hija.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa, en persas y ferias para ofrecer su mercadería, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad. Su venta de ropa es solo para damas.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en locales y distribuidoras donde encuentra ropa de diferentes modelos y tallas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará poleras, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, para damas.
Una de las metas de Maria Jose es instalar un bazar en su casa, adaptar un espacio especifico para atender a su clientela y ofrecer su mercadería de manera más tranquila, así con esto optar a  una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria Jose vive junto a su marido, esposo y dos hijas de 4 y 1 año de edad. Sus a nivel personal y familiar e s tener su casa propia para brindarle lo mejor a sus hijas.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Recoleta es una de las 34 comunas de Santiago (capital de Chile) y se encuentra ubicada en el sector centro-norte del Santiago, región metropolitana. Cuenta con un activo comercio, destacando el barrio comercial de Patronato que ha acogido principalmente a comerciantes árabes (en un principio) y coreanos (en la actualidad).
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Chacabuco” and has 15 enterprising members who carry out different lines of work among which are: pastry making, turnover sales, kiosk, manicure, clothes sales, ice-cream sales, cake sales and services, among others.  They all are from Recoleta Commune located in Santiago Commune.

María José is a communal bank member and in the photo she’s squatting down in the first row, first from right to left, wearing blue jeans and a beige sweater, her hair is dark brown and she wears it up and she's carrying her daughter in her arms.

She has been selling clothes for two years.  She comments that she works at home, in street markets and street fairs to sell her merchandise.  Her work schedule is determined by her availability.  She only sells women’s clothes.  She buys merchandise as needed from stores and suppliers where she finds different styles and sizes of clothes at low cost which gives her an economic advantage.  She will use the loan to buy shirts, pants, dresses and skirts for women.

One of María's goals is to open a store at home, to set aside specific space to tend to her customers and offer her products more in peace.  In this way she’ll be having better quality of life.

María José lives with her husband and two daughters who are 4 and 1.  Her personal and family goal is to own a house to provide the best for her daughters.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is providing because it’s made it possible for her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable in the company of her fellow entrepreneurs in her communal bank group because they share different activities and interests which has also served as a means of recreation for her.  The training provided at the meetings has taught her to better manage her business.

Recoleta is one of the 34 communes making up Santiago (Capital of Chile) and is located in Santiago’s north-central sector, metropolitan region.  It’s active commercially and the commercial Patronato neighborhood stands out mainly for having welcomed Arab merchants (initially) and Korean ones (currently).

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva Rosa hizo muchas cosas, compró una lavadora y peliculas en CD, su negocio creció y ahora le ha alcanzado para pagar estudios, por eso esta haciendo un curso de belleza para poder obtener nuevos ingresos y justamente con su nuevo credikiva, al que ahora aplica, comprará herramientas para manicure, pedicure, equipos e insumos de belleza para sacarle dinero a una de las actividades que mas le gusta como la belleza. Está muy satisfecha porque cuenta con una nueva clientela que tambien multiplicará sus ingresos por los servicios que ofrece. Ella está dichosa y dice a sus finaciadores de Kiva: Gracias por su ayuda, con esto se cumplen todos los proyectos.
texts.en:
Rosa did many things with her previous loan.  She bought a washer and movies on CDs.  Her business grew, and she has now managed to pay for her education.  That is why she is taking a beauty course in order to get new income.

With the new Kiva loan that she is now applying for she will buy tools for manicures and pedicures, equipment, and beauty supplies in order to get money from one of the business activities that she likes the most, beauty.

She is very happy because she has new clientele, which will also increase her income for the services she provides.  She is fortunate, and she says to the Kiva lenders, “Thanks for your help with which all of my projects will be completed.”

loans.use: to buy tools for manicures and pedicures, equipment, and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Alegria - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ALEGRIA – 26 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres, y dos varones, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra Lourdes  tiene 30 años tiene 1 hijo pequeño, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos para autos ya sea ambientador, fundas, ella  vende en una estación de servicio ofreciendo sus productos a los choferes que cargan  combustible,  tiene ya muchos clientes, la Sra. Lourdes es cliente antigua ya que este préstamo es el  tercero que solicito en la institución,  la Sra. Lourdes va a usar este préstamo para la compra de artículos para autos al por mayor,  la Sra. Lourdes enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención y comprando variedad de productos, la Sra. Lourdes se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: The entrepreneurial bank ALEGRIA - 26 is comprised of eight members,of whom six are women and two are men. The bank's president, Lourdes, is 30 years old and has one small child. She works as a retailer, offering a variety of automotive products such as air fresheners and covers. She sells her products from a roadside station to drivers who stop to refuel, and she already has a number of customers. Lourdes is a long-standing client and this is her third loan with this instituion. Lourdes will use the funds to purchase her automotive products at wholesale prices.  One of the challenges she faces in this business is the demand for the latest products, but she will use this loan to better meet her customers' needs by purchasing a variety of items. Lourdes is happy and grateful to the institution for the assistance it has provided in authorizing this loan.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale auto supplies.

loans.name: Dellys

texts.es: Dellys con su anterior credikiva compró telas, hilos, botones, camisas, suéteres, chancletas, y calzado en general. Su credikiva lao benefició en el mejoramiento de sus ingresos y especialmente de sus condiciones habitacionales, cuando ganó un poco mas de dinero con esa inversión. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento y con el comprará materias primas, como corredores, pellones, botones, hilos, y mercancías variadas, con las cuales atenderá las necesidades de su fiel clientela. En esta ultima temporada comercial del año, ella espera incrementar aun mas sus ventas, fabricando prendas de vestir  elegantes, para que las familias luzcan, en las festividades de navidades y año nuevo,  hermosas con los vestidos elaborados que fabrica Dellys.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Dellys bought fabric, thread, buttons, shirts, sweaters, sandals, and footwear in general. Her Kiva loan benefitted her by improving her income and especially her housing conditions, as she earned a bit more money with that investment. 

Currently she is applying for a new loan, and will use it to buy raw materials such as trim, interfacings, buttons, thread, and a variety of merchandise with which she will serve the needs of her loyal clientele. 

In this latest sales season of the year, she hopes to increase her sales even more by making elegant articles of clothing, so that families will look beautiful in the Christmas and New Year's festivities, wearing the well-made dresses that Dellys makes.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as trim, interfacing, buttons, thread and a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Yarnelis Rosa

texts.es: Yarnelis  compró hamacas, sombreros, panchas, sandalias y bolsos, que vendió muy bien y ganó dinero y esto fue gracia a su credikiva. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento con le cual comprará hamacas y sombreros que están en promoción y con ellos estará muy satisfecha su clientela por los buenos precios que ha conseguido especialmente para esta temporada que se avecina con grandes oportunidades de ganar un poco mas de dinero.  En su mensaje a los financiadores  de Kiva pide  que sigan con esa labor, pues  como a ella, está beneficiando  a mucha gente.
texts.en: Yarnelis bought hammocks, hats, sandals and bags, which sold very well. She earned profits thanks to her Kiva loan. She's currently requesting a new loan, which she'll use to purchase hammocks and hats that are on sale. Her customers will be very satisfied with them because of the good prices she has secured specially for the upcoming season, which brings great opportunities to earn a little more money. Her message to Kiva lenders is to keep up their work, because it benefits a lot of people like her.

loans.use: to purchase hammocks and hats.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Alba, tiene 27 años de edad, vive en una aldea rural del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara con su conyugue y sus dos hijos. 
Alba estuvo trabajando varios años en una fábrica maquiladora y hace 8 meses quedó sin empleo, y con sus ahorros decidió iniciar su propio negocio de pulpería para vender productos de consumo diario. Ella vende granos básicos, pastillas, manteca, churros, dulces, pastas, salsina y huevos. y para surtir la pulpería e incrementar las ventas y los ingresos ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 12,000 Lempiras con el cual comprara más productos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, café, sal, pan, manteca, huevos, medicamentos y productos de limpieza e higiene. Su fin es mantener surtido el negocio para ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos y aumentar la clientela ya que viene la época buena para las ventas. Su meta es tener un negocio grande bien surtido para darles la educación a sus hijos y lograr también construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en: Alba, 27, lives in a rural village in the municipality of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara with her spouse and two children.  Alba worked for several years at an assembly plant but became unemployed 8 months ago and decided to use her savings to start her own grocery store business and sell basic staples.  She sells basic grains, pills, lard, snacks, candy, noodles, sauce and eggs and in order to stock the store and increase sales and income has decided to request a 12,000 Lempira loan to buy more products like rice, sugar, beans, coffee, salt, bread, lard, eggs, medicine and cleaning supplies.  Her goal is to keep the store stocked to offer greater amounts of products and increase her clientele because the good sales season is approaching.  Her goal is to have a well-stocked large store to provide her children with schooling and also to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
This is Richard, who previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase additional stocks of mineral water and LPG tanks needed in his business. His resulting increased earnings have been a big help in the education of his children and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Richard is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for additional stocks of mineral water and LPG tanks needed in his business. More items to sell will result in better profit which will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and his children's educational expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Richard dreams of growing his business in the coming years. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to upgrade his facilities and buy more stocks of mineral water needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mirasol requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like spices, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc. in her general store.

Mirasol has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Mirasol would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like spices, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Nahomie De Danda 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Nanotte est le coordinatrice de son groupe Nahomie de Danda. Elle est un commercante. ils habite dans la région  de Danda  où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. 

Nanotte a dirigé son  commerce de produit alimentaire pendant 6 années.  Avant de commencer ce commerce Naanotte était un Etudiant.  Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans  les produit alimentaires et elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son commerce.

Des autres membres  militant  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces de produit divers comme charbon, cosmetiques, chaussures, vetement, etc. Nanotte dit que les  défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Nanotte is the coordinator of her group Nahomie de Danda. She is a merchant and lives in the Danda region, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Nanotte has been running her business selling groceries for six years. Before starting this, she was a student. She would like to use this loan to invest in grocery items, and she hopes this loan will help her to expand her business. 

Other active members of the group have need of a loan for businesses involving a variety of goods, such as in charcoal, cosmetics, shoes, clothing, etc.  Nanotte says that the main challenges include becoming a major merchant.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Gabriela Pascuala

texts.es: La Sra. Gabriela tiene 44 años y tiene cuatro hijos de las edades de 17, 15, 13 y ocho años todos se encuentran estudiando,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos como saladitos ya sea papas fritas y chicharroncitos en su tienda  que se encuentra en un  lugar estratégico de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,   este préstamo es su cuarta  secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Gabriela va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción como cemento cerámica para construcción de su vivienda,   razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  quiere mejorar los ambientes de su hogar, la Sra. Gabriela  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando material de construcción  para el mejoramiento de su hogar y también en la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda,  su deseo es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera genera más ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gabriela is 44 years old and has four children aged 17, 15, 13 and 8. All of them attend school. She sells products such as snacks, fries and cracklings in her store, which is located on a strategic spot in the town of Santa Cruz. This is her fourth loan with the institution. Gabriela will use this loan to purchase construction supplies such as cement and ceramics in order to build her house. The reason she requests this loan is that she wishes to improve the rooms in her home. Gabriela will use the proceeds to buy construction supplies for home improvement, and also to buy merchandise for stocking up her store. Her wish is to own a stable, profitable business and therefore earn better profits so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Pelagia Teodocia

texts.es: La Sra. Pelagia  tiene 44 años y 4 hijos que son 18, 16, 14 y 9 años de edad, todos s encuentran estudiando,   su actividad es la atención de una pensión, en la que sirven platos como: Caldo de Cardan, thimpu, sajta etc. En su restaurante que se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Villa Fátima,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Pelagia  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos al por mayor para su negocio como  (papa, chuño, arroz, etc.) para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos productos imprescindibles para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Sra.  Pelagia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el negocio está ubicado en el segundo piso de un edificio lo cual dificulta en cierta manera las ventas, pero aun así tiene clientes y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos al por mayor, el deseo de la Sra. Pelagia es poder conseguir un anticrético de una tienda amplia ubicada en el primer piso, para que así su tienda sea más visible hacia los clientes.
texts.en:
Pelagia, 44, has four children who are 18, 16, 14 and 9 years of age; all attend school.  Her activity is running an eatery located in the Villa Fátima zone where she serves such dishes as ‘Caldo de Cardan’ [bull penis and testicles soup], ‘thimpu’ [boiled lamb shank], ‘sajta’ [spicy stewed chicken], etc.

This loan is Pelagia’s first sequence in the institution and she will use it to buy ingredients like potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, rice, etc. at wholesale to prepare the delicious dishes for her restaurant.  Her reason for requesting this loan is the lack of cash to buy these essential ingredients needed to make her dishes.

The business challenge Pelagia faces is that’s it’s located on the second floor of a building which somewhat limits sales but even so she has customers and will use profits to continue buying ingredients at wholesale.  

Pelagia’s wish is to be able to get a spacious store at ground level using the ‘anticrético’ [transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] modality so that customers will be able to see it more easily.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.es: La Sra. Anselma tiene 36 años,  se dedica a la venta de rellenos, tucumanas, sopa de fideo y silpanchos en una pequeña pensión que se encuentran ubicado en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Anselma va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como papa y aceite para la elaboración de sus platillos ya que hay épocas en las que por diferentes fiestas se llena su pensión   lo cual temporalmente incrementan sus ventas para lo cual necesitara de mas capital para poder atender a esa clientela,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo, Anselma enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que atiende sola su negocio, por lo cual  en muchas ocasiones no puede atender rápidamente lo que  hace que los clientes se molesten y  va a utilizar los beneficios para contratar una persona que le ayude a cocinar y a brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en: Anselma, 36, sells stuffed potatoes, turnovers, vermicelli and ‘silpancho’ [meat and rice dish served with fried egg] in a small eatery she has located in a strategic spot in the city of La Paz.
